item.dc:creator: @Scape-JAVA Scape-JAVA
item.description:
@Scape-JAVA wrote:

if (height <= 5) ;
Why are you putting the semicolon on a separate line? You’re just making your program long and tedious to read. And why do you have so many scanner objects?

And why are the messages so vulgar?

item.title: My sexy code
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

There’s no need to create new scanner each time you want to ask a question, also, you only declared the fields locally, which is the reason it didn’t work properly. The reason you got errors is because you had a semicolon at this line when there should’ve been a bracket: if (weight >= 200);


import java.util.*;

public class Funny {
	private static final Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
	private static int weight;
	private static int height;
	private static int age;
	private static int guess;

	public static void main(String[] args) {
		System.out.println("Let's start the game :P");
		height();
		weight();
		age();
		end();
	}

	public static void height() {
		System.out.println("What is your height? (In feet please)");
		height = scanner.nextInt();
		if (height <= 5) {
			System.out.println("Oh shit, You're a midget! " + height
					+ "Feet,  LOL big people, your world.");
		} else if (height > 5) {
			System.out.println("Oh fuck you tall son of a bitch..... Dam, "
					+ height + "Feet tall... What the fuck.");
		}
	}

	public static void weight() {
		System.out.println("What is your weight ?");
		weight = scanner.nextInt();
		if (weight >= 200) {
			System.out.println("Okay Mr. " + weight
					+ " Pounds, *COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*");
		} else if (weight <= 100) {
			System.out.println("Jesus you fucking stick! How the fuck are you "
					+ weight + "Pounds!!");
		} else {
			System.out.println("Average faggot.");
		}
	}

	public static void age() {
		System.out.println("Hey fag, please tell me your age.");
		age = scanner.nextInt();
		System.out.println("Okay, So let me get this straight, you're "
				+ height + "feet tall," + weight + " pounds, and " + age
				+ " years old....");
		System.out.println("Calculating Information...");
		System.out.println("...");
		System.out.println("You're a: Faggot.");
	}

	public static void end() {
		System.out.println("But! There is one way you can not be a complete faggot.");
		System.out.println("All you have to do is guess the number.");
		System.out.println("Now what do you think the number is?");
		guess = scanner.nextInt();
		if (guess == 2) {
			System.out.println("Processing...");
			System.out.println("...");
			System.out.println("You are: Not a faggot anymore!");
		} else if (guess != 2) {
			System.out.println("You are still a faggot. The answer was 2.");
		}
	}
}

You should definetly read some more of Java, it’s not really that hard, think of methods as a closed box, if you store info inside the box, you cannot access it from outside the box. Those variables stored within the class can be accessed ‘outside the box’, other classes can access them aswell, it depends if you declare them as ‘private’, which means that the variables can only be accessed by the methods that are in that class. If you declare a variable as ‘private’ and want to access it by other classes you can make setters and getters, which are simple as public int getVariable() { return variable; } and public void setVariable(int i) { variable = i; }.

Read full topic

item.title: My sexy code
item.dc:creator: @Onix Onix
item.description:
@Onix wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:7, topic:451322”]None of your if-statements do anything.

if (condition == anotherCondition) {
    // your message
}

The semicolon is not necessary.[/quote]You should have said

if (condition) { // Message }Where the condition returns a boolean. You don’t have to compare two conditions for an if statement.

Read full topic

It’ll help you find errors more easily because you’d have consistency in indentation and usage of line breaks.
Much easier on the eye and less error prone.

public class Funny {
public static String HEIGHT = “”;

public static void main(String[] args) {

	end();
}

public static void height() {
	System.out.println("What is your height? (In feet please)");
	Scanner heigh = new Scanner(System.in);

	if (height <= 5){

			+ "Feet,  LOL big people, your world.");

	if (weight >= 200);
	System.out.println("Okay Mr. " + weight
			+ " Pounds, *COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*");
	else if (weight <= 100){
	System.out.println("Jesus you fucking stick! How the fuck are you "	+ weight + "Pounds!!");
} else {
	System.out.println("Average faggot.");
		}
	}

public static void age() {
	System.out.println("Hey fag, please tell me your age.");
	Scanner ager = new Scanner(System.in);

	System.out.println("Okay, So let me get this straight, you're "

			+ " years old....");

	System.out.println("...");
	System.out.println("You're a: Faggot.");
}

public static void end() {
	System.out.println("But! There is one way you can not be a complete faggot.");
	System.out.println("All you have to do is guess the number.");

@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

None of your if-statements do anything.

if (condition == anotherCondition) {
    // your message
}

The semicolon is not necessary.

Read full topic

item.title: My sexy code
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

You can write an if statement without brackets (the { and the }), and the code inside the block would be the line after that.

For example (albeit shitty):

if (expression)
	System.out.println("Inside.");
System.out.println("Outside.");

Otherwise use brackets:

if (expression)
{
	System.out.println("Inside.");
	System.out.println("Also inside.");
}

Read full topic

Hey guys my code is fucked up. The else if statements just don’t work… Does anyone know how to fix those?
PS: How would i create a run.bat for this?

[code]import java.util.*;

public class Funny {
public static String HEIGHT = “”;
public static String WEIGHT = “”;

public static void main(String[] args) {

	end();
}

public static void height() {
	System.out.println("What is your height? (In feet please)");
	Scanner heigh = new Scanner(System.in);
	int height = heigh.nextInt();
	if (height <= 5)
		;
	System.out.println("Oh shit, You're a midget! " + height
			+ "Feet,  LOL big people, your world.");
	else if (height != 6)
		;
	System.out.println("Oh fuck you tall son of a bitch..... Dam, "
			+ height + "Feet tall... What the fuck.");
}

public static void weight() {
	System.out.println("What is your weight ?");
	Scanner weigher = new Scanner(System.in);
	int weight = weigher.nextInt();
	if (weight >= 200)
		;
	System.out.println("Okay Mr. " + weight
			+ " Pounds, *COUGH* Fatass *COUGH*");
	if (weight <= 100)
		;
	System.out.println("Jesus you fucking stick! How the fuck are you "
			+ weight + "Pounds!!");
	System.out.println("Average faggot.");
}

public static void age() {
	System.out.println("Hey fag, please tell me your age.");

	System.out.println("Okay, So let me get this straight, you're "
			+ HEIGHT + "feet tall," + WEIGHT + "pounds, and " + age
			+ " years old....");

	System.out.println("...");
	System.out.println("You're a: Faggot.");
}

public static void end() {
	System.out
			.println("But! There is one way you can not be a complete faggot.");
	System.out.println("All you have to do is guess the number.");
	System.out.println("Now what do you think the number is?");

	int guess = guesser.nextInt();
